title: Play button with fullscreen video and optional timer overlay

requirements.text: Add a visible play/pause button to the UI. Clicking the button or pressing the spacebar should toggle video playback between playing and paused states.

quotes: let there be a playbutton,and whenever I press space,or click on it, it should pause or play the video

acceptanceCriteria: A play/pause button is visible in the UI.
Clicking the button toggles the video between playing and paused.
Pressing the spacebar toggles the video between playing and paused.
The button icon reflects the current state (play icon when paused, pause icon when playing).

requirements.text: When the video starts playing, the UI enters a fullscreen mode that hides all application chrome (navigation bars, panels, controls, overlays) and shows only the video filling the entire screen.

quotes: when the video plays, it should be in fullscreen,not showing anything, only the video

acceptanceCriteria: Triggering play causes the video to expand to fullscreen.
All UI elements (navigation, bottom bar, panels, play button) are hidden during fullscreen playback.
Pausing the video (via spacebar) exits fullscreen and restores the normal UI.
The video fills the entire viewport with no visible chrome.

requirements.text: Provide a user-accessible toggle or setting that lets the user choose between two fullscreen playback modes: (1) plain video with no overlays, and (2) the user's currently selected timer displayed as an overlay on top of the fullscreen video. The chosen mode should persist across sessions.

quotes: the user should have a choice: let the video be plain, or add the timer they choose layered on top of the video

acceptanceCriteria: A toggle or setting is available that switches between 'plain video' and 'video with timer overlay' modes.
In 'plain video' mode, fullscreen playback shows only the video with no overlays.
In 'video with timer overlay' mode, the user's chosen timer (e.g., countdown, pomodoro, stopwatch) is rendered on top of the fullscreen video.
The timer overlay is readable and does not obscure the entire video.
The selected mode is persisted to localStorage and restored on reload.

constraints: Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
The fullscreen video must use the existing background video/YouTube player infrastructure (BackgroundStage, YouTubeBackgroundPlayer) rather than introducing a new media pipeline.
nonGoals: Adding new background sources or changing how backgrounds are set.
Modifying the timer logic or countdown behavior.
Changing the bottom bar layout beyond hiding it during fullscreen playback.
